thread.title: Byron Bay lifestyle blocks near Pat Rafter's rural retreat up for sale
thread.title_full: Byron Bay lifestyle blocks near Pat Rafter's rural retreat up for sale | afr.com

author: Share via Email
title: Byron Bay lifestyle blocks near Pat Rafter's rural retreat up for sale
text:
A lot: A 160-hectare parcel of rural land between Byron Bay and Lennox Head in northern NSW is up for sale Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Larry Schlesinger A 160-hectare parcel of rural land between Byron Bay and Lennox Head in northern NSW has been listed for sale by receivers PPB Advisory close to where Australian tennis champ Patrick Rafter recently bought land for a family retreat.
The property on Newrybar Swamp Road is available for purchase in one line or as for separate lots of about 40 hectares each through Chris Harley and Barry Quinn of Ray White Rural Brisbane.
CoreLogic RP Data records show the property last sold for $3.8 million in 2007 with Byron Bay businessman and developer Owen Lynn and his wife Margaret listed as joint tenants on the title deed.
There has been a spate of rural block acquisitions in Broken Head in the past 12 months. The area is renowned for its nature reserve, sub-tropical rainforests and surfing beach.
Earlier this month, two-time US Open champion Rafter and wife Lara purchased a coastal Byron Bay paddock for a family retreat.
The Rafters paid $1.35 million for the 28 hectares grazing property at 146 Midgen Flat Road, Broken Head, well down from its earlier $1.75 million listing.
In June a 37-hectare property on Byron Bay Road sold for $1.65 million and in January, a 40-hectare Broken Head block on Owenia Way sold for $1.2 million.
According to Mr Quinn, the Newrybar Swamp Road property has been used to grow sugar cane and more recently macadamia trees and will suit buyers looking for a lifestyle property close to the coast and just a 15-minute drive from the resort town of Byron Bay.
 He said the opportunity to secure a coastal landholding of this size close to Byron Bay was rare.
Each parcel of land has elevated and sizeable building sites on which to construct a home. The property is surrounded by timber post and wire boundary and internal fencing creating 14 paddocks and a set of stockyards.
There are multiple dams on the property.
The properties are to be sold by expressions of interest, with the campaign closing on August 27.
